page.title: 10LODGE CARR FARM DONCASTER
page.content: I sometimes get fed up with my home life. My friends rarely visit because they would have to walk over a mile. Since I was born 14 years ago I have only had one full weeks holiday because we cannot leave the cows. Then again it is peaceful with only the sounds of birds, tractors and animals. Our dairy farm in Loversall is very wet because it is low down: 5 feet below sea level in places. It can be hot and dry in summer but in winter nearly all our fields are partly flooded. I help to fetch the cows in and milk them. We have about 30 cows but last year when the milk quotas came in we were told to produce 9% less than 1983 and as we were flooded then we didn't send in as much as usual. We had hoped to be farming 100 cows with someone on contract to milk them.
